text:
Hello can anyone help me
how we can show the WordPress recent blog posts in the HubSpot page dynamically?

that’s like asking; how do you actually build a bike? :slightly_smiling_face: as far as I know, there’s no integration / plugin that pushes wordpress posts to HubSpot, but you could google a bit, you never know. If that’s not available, what you’d need to do is build a nice little wordpress plugin that pushes wordpress posts (or the metadata you need to display them) to a hubdb, using the api. Then you can build a HubSpot module that reads the hubdb table and spits out the posts on a page.

You could try using the RSS Listing Tag in your template to make this happen.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#rss-listing>
I am not fully sure about your use case. But there is a blog importer that brings wordpress blog posts to HubSpot.. Not sure what is the purpose of using hubdb here..

While this is a great idea to push posts to HubDB for displaying, I agree with Gobi and a HubDB solution may be over complicating it. We do have the RSS Listing tag that they could most likely use to accomplish what they are looking for.
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/tags#rss-listing>
I had a dynamic hubdb table that i reverted to no longer be dynamic. After i updated the table, the dynamic page still exists. How can I delete that page?
Did u publish the table after reverting?
Can you send me the page url?

Thanks for the information.
Is there anyway to import contacts to a HubDB table?

Can you do it dynamically?
So when when there's an update in contacts, it should reflect to the HubDB table
